inn1.comm: Back of a length on off stump, back and across to defend towards short midwicket
full outside off, slanting away, defended to short cover
back of  a length, a touch too straight. Jamshed tucks it away through square leg to pick up his first World Cup run
Shehzad didn't know much about that. Was halfway forward to this ball that threatened to shape away from him. Nipped back a touch, and he inside-edged it onto his thigh pad
fuller now, on middle and off, Shehzad plays a checked drive to mid-on
length ball on a sixth-stump line, left alone
starts with a fullish ball on middle and off, and Jamshed defends to short midwicket
back of a length on middle and off and he shuffles across to tuck it away towards square leg
back of a length, fourth-stump line, defended solidly down the ground, towards mid-off
back of a length on off and middle, worked to square leg off the back foot
a little fuller, on an off-stump line, defended to short midwicket

got him! He was out for a duck in the previous game, and this time he's out for 1. It's a short ball and he swivels to pull from outside off, but he only succeeds in giving square leg an easy catch at knee height

big appeal for lbw, Shehzad's front foot barely came forward for that. It was fairly full, nipped back and pinged him on the front pad as his head fell over while looking to play through the on side. Would have missed leg stump, and probably bounced over as well
short, very wide outside off. Shehzad thinks about slashing at it, decides against it
now he overcompensates and slides one down the leg side
full again, attacking the pads. Shehzad opens up to defend towards mid-on
full again, outside off, punched to mid-off
back of a length outside off, defended back to the bowler
fullish, just outside off, and Chibhabha makes a super diving stop at mid-on, sprawling to his left, to stop that firmly struck punch down the ground from Shehzad
full outside off, comes forward to drive, may have been looking at mid-off, but the bat-face closed in his hand and he ended up hitting it towards mid-on
what a leave that is. That was angled across, very close to off stump, and shaping in just a touch, but Haris trusted the bounce and left it alone
another leave, this one's a much easier decision, was just that bit wider outside off
on the pads, was in too closed a position to be able to flick it, and it rolled off his thigh pad towards square leg
length ball on a fifth-stump line, left alone

he's struck with an absolute peach! That was angled in, and it took off from a length, and nipped away just a touch. Kissed the outside edge, high up on the bat, and carried through to the keeper at shoulder height. Shehzad had to play at it, because it was very close to off stump, but if you want to fault him you'd point to his lack of footwork
full outside off and he gets his front foot across to poke it away towards point
back of a length on off stump, worked away through square leg
back of a length, angling in towards middle stump, shuffles across to push it to short midwicket
fullish outside off, left alone
length ball, goes wider of the crease and angles it in, but it's still wide enough for Misbah to leave
gets even more angle on this one, and raps Misbah on the front pad as he plonks his foot forward to defend. Got his pad well outside the line

now Misbah takes a preliminary front-and-across shuffle to get himself outside off even before the bowler delivers. He sends down a length ball on a fifth-stump line and Misbah waves it through to the keeper
length ball angling across towards off stump, defended to mid-off
full on middle stump, and Haris punches it sweetly down the ground, just shows it the full face and sends it racing away between bowler and mid-on
now Chatara goes wider, invites the cover drive, and Haris ignores it
back of a length, wide outside off again, Haris leaves again
back of a length on middle stump, goes on the back foot and pokes it into the gap between short midwicket and mid-on
full outside off, driven to short cover
back of a length outside off, defended towards point
a touch shorter and he takes a big step back and across for the back-foot punch, but it doesn't quite come on and he ends up hitting it back towards the bowler, off the inside half of the bat
beauty. Just full enough to bring Haris' weight forward but not his front foot, and he ends up poking at it away from his body and missing
a bit fuller and wider, Haris leaves it alone
now Haris shuffles outside off before Mupariwa delivers, and defends the back-of-a-length ball towards short cover
that's fuller and slanted exaggeratedly outside off, goes wide of the tramline
fullish on a fourth-stump line, blocked to short cover
fullish on off stump. Misbah shuffles across rather than come forward and defends towards mid-on
length ball shaping away outside off, left alone
length ball angling in towards off stump. Misbah defends towards short cover
back of a length outside off, Misbah leaves again
back of a length on middle stump, nudged defensively towards short midwicket
shortish, angling into the shuffling Misbah, who gets on his toes to tuck it away off his hips towards fine leg

full on off stump and Pakistan's misery is summed up by how that punchy, gorgeous drive from Misbah ends up smacking the stumps at the other end and going nowhere. Only thing worse would have been a deflection off the bowler's fingers and the non-striker out of his crease
length ball on off stump, defended to short cover
lovely delivery, Misbah is in a tangle, having to play around his front pad as this one comes in from outside off and thuds into its flap
moves his line wider and Misbah leaves it alone
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
short and wide, gets on top of it to cut but can't beat Williams diving to his left at point
too straight, pushed off the back foot to the left of mid-on
full and wide, driven to short cover
fullish outside off, gets on the front foot and dabs it towards gully

and again, that delivery angled in from wide of the crease. Misbah is shuffling so much he always has to hit these around his front pad. Strikes his pad right in front of middle and off but the bounce on this pitch will ensure bowlers won't get too many lbws
length ball angling in towards off stump, defended back to the bowler
full outside off, comes forward and pokes it to the left of mid-off
back of a length on off stump, blocked to short cover
back of a length outside off. Shuffles across and nurdles it towards short midwicket
fullish outside off, big front-foot stride to drive to mid-off
a burst of aggression out of nowhere. Walks across and whips this off-stump ball off his pads, in the air backward of square. Doesn't carry as far as long leg running across to his left
banged in short outside off, Misbah thinks of an uppercut but decides it's too high to go after
fuller now, on off and middle, defended towards short midwicket
good ball, nips in from outside off as Misbah comes forward to drive on the up. Inside-edges it onto his back thigh
length ball angling away from off stump, left alone
a bit fuller and he entices the on-the-up drive from Haris. His feet go nowhere, though, and his bat connects with nothing
shuffles across as the bowler is running in, and then comes forward to defend the length ball towards short cover
a bit fuller, close to off stump, driven to mid-off
and now the pressure tells on Haris. It's a routine length ball angled away from him, and he's beaten trying for a horrible slog across the line

lovely ball, this. Back of a length, angling across, and he shapes to play the back foot punch and draws his bat inside the line at the last moment, so it falls somewhere in the grey part of the spectrum between beaten and left alone
back of a length outside off, dabbed away to third man
full outside off, punched firmly but too close to mid-off
drifts onto the pads and he tucks it away to long leg
back of a length outside off, dabbed away to the left of backward point
full on off stump, driven to mid-off

down the track comes Haris and he plays that slog again. This time he's close enough to the ball to be able to middle it, just about, and hit it over wide mid-on. Stops two-thirds of the way to the boundary but the batsmen run four anyway
back of a length outside off, defended towards short cover
full, angling into leg stump. Misbah has to play around his pads to flick that, doesn't time it at all, rolls to short midwicket
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
fullish outside off, stretches out to steer it towards third man
full outside off, driven down the ground and mid-off, who's stationed very straight, doesn't have too far to move to his left to cut it off
full on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
fuller now, clipped down to long-on
floated up full outside off and Misbah drives inside-out and finds the boundary to the right of the sweeper cover fielder
loopy outside off and he presses out to defend to short cover
full outside off, driven down to long-off
flat and round-arm on off stump, shuffles across to work it away wide of short midwicket
back of a length outside off, guided down to third man
back of a length on off stump. Misbah looks to steer it away with an open face, can't beat backward point
full outswinger outside off, poked down to mid-off
fullish on off stump, clipped to short midwicket
length ball outside off, presses forward to dab it to backward point
full outside off, stretches out and looks for the poked single to short cover, but the fielder rushes in quickly to prevent it
length ball on the pads, nudged away to backward square leg
down the track, gets inside the line of this ball angled into his feet, drives inside-out to long-off
on the pads, worked away through square leg
makes room by moving outside leg, and he bowls it full and straight, on middle stump. Blocked into the off side
back of a length on middle and off, punched down the ground to long-on
long-hop, and Misbah easily puts that away, pulling it witheringly to the midwicket boundary
slower ball on middle and off, defended to short cover
back of a length outside off, steered down to third man
length ball slanting away from off stump, dabbed away to third man
length ball on a tight off-stump line. Misbah lets it come on and pokes it to backward point
full on off stump, whipped to short midwicket
starts with a back of a length ball way down the leg side. Would have been a pretty good ball had Misbah been on strike

back of a length on middle stump, tucked away to the left of short midwicket. He wanted a single, Misbah sent him back, and the indecision gave Raza plenty of time to run to his left and dive to cut it off
oh my. That was so far outside off it would have missed the 19th stump
and again. This one's fuller, invites the attemped flat-bat slap from Haris, but he was never going to connect
back of a length, angling in. Not enough room for the cut and Haris plays and misses
oh my, he's really struggling here. That just didn't come out of his hand right and it slipped through very full, between the tramline and the return crease outside off
back of a length outside off, Haris goes back and across to guide it to third man
back of a length, angling into off stump. Shuffles across and works it away through backward square leg
back of a length, angling down the leg side, tucked away off the hips towards fine leg
length ball outside off, stretches out to prod it to point
down the leg side and that's a poor ball with fine leg in the circle. Haris clips it away just wide of the fielder, who has no chance of stopping it even with a desperate dive to his right
good reply. Floats it up outside off, not quite driving length, and beats Haris who goes hard at it with an angled bat
back of a length, angling away from Haris, chopped away very fine, to the right of third man
length ball on off stump, presses forward to block to short extra cover
full and wide, driven to sweeper cover
full on off stump, comes forward and knocks it deftly to the right of short cover
and he strikes first ball! With a long-hop! Haris snatched at that pull, and hit it straight to short midwicket
tossed up on middle and leg, clipped away wide of short midwicket
back of a length, angling across towards off stump, punched back towards the bowler
back of a length again, close to off stump, goes on the back foot and blocks it back to the bowler
a bit fuller and Misbah goes for the reverse-sweep. Uses the angle well but short fine leg does well to dive to his left and stop that from going for four
short ball, pulled away to deep square leg
full on off stump, driven down to long-on
back of a length on off stump,defended to short extra cover
full on middle and leg, clipped away through forward square leg
full outside off, presses forward to push this to short extra cover
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot towards short midwicket
back of a length outside off, dabbed to backward point
tossed up on off stump, comes forward looking for the pushed single to mid-off but the fielder is too quick to allow that
down the leg side and he tucks it away towards short fine leg
full on leg stump, clipped to short midwicket
full on leg again, and this time Misbah flicks straight to square leg
a bit of flight on off stump and Misbah almost holes out. Goes over the top, doesn't middle it, and he's lucky that bounces before it reaches long-on
good ball, floating away from Akmal and carrying on with the angle. Goes for the big drive, can't connect
length ball outside off, blocked towards short extra cover

full and wide and that's an excellent shot from Misbah. Drives with a lot of bottom hand to get it into the gap between short cover and mid-off, and the fielder chasing back from mid-off, Chigumbura, trips over as he tries to dive, and ends up sprawled on the ground as the ball rolls away into the boundary. He looks to have injured himself here, and the physio is on the field. His right foot got caught in the turf, and he fell heavily on his left knee. He's back on his feet, and he's being helped off the field. Walking gingerly, but he's walking, and that's good news.
back of a length outside off. Lets it come on and looks for the open-faced dab, can't beat point
back of a length on off stump, and once again he can't steer that past point
short ball outside off, steered away to the right of third man
full on the pads, tucked away to the left of long leg and Akmal is quick, completes the second comfortably even though Panyangara's throw hit the stumps direct
tossed up on off stump, plonks his front foot across to paddle that towards fine leg
length ball on leg stump, clips it uppishly towards short midwicket, off the leading edge
fullish on off stump, pushed down to mid-on for the quick single
on the pads now, whipped away to deep midwicket
back of a length, tucks Misbah up as he goes on the back foot to whip it through the leg side. Can only defend in the end, towards short midwicket
very full on off stump, whipped back to the bowler
full on off stump, clipped down to long-on
back of a length on off stump, punched down to long-off
floated up, angling in towards middle and leg, clipped to short fine leg
back of a length, angling in towards leg stump, tucked away towards straight midwicket
short, and he's deep in his crease in a flash to pull it away, up and over midwicket
fired into the pads quick and he tickles it away fine, uses the pace very well, and short fine leg has to dive to his right to stop that
tossed up on off stump, driven down to long-off
a bit of flight on off and middle and he gets down low to lap it away towards fine leg
a bit fuller on off stump, paddled away again, hits it closer to the fine leg fielder this time
shortish, but it turns in and tucks him up for room as he shapes to cut. Dabs it to short third man in the end
tossed up outside off and he gets his head nice and low over the ball to drive it to the left of long-off
quicker now, straightens towards off stump, and Akmal, looking to go inside-out again, has to change his mind and defend
Misbah makes some room and he follows him, firing it into his feet. Driven inside-out to long-off
full on the pads, worked away to the right of short midwicket
tossed up on middle stump, makes room and drives firmly, inside-out, and it would have been four had Ervine not dived to his right and slowed it down at short cover
quickish length ball on middle stump, clipped to straight midwicket
a touch short on off stump, short enough for Akmal, rocks back and swivels through his hips to pull it away to the wide long-on boundary
tossed up outside off, gets inside the line and pokes it towards point
short outside off, and Misbah rides the bounce to force it away wide of backward point, to the right of third man
angling down the leg side, glanced very fine, and the long leg fielder has absolutely no hope of stopping that
full and wide and that's a crisp drive from Akmal, once again excellent work from short cover, diving to his right to stop it
short outside off. Rises quite high and Akmal drops his hands and sways away from the line
Akmal was shuffling down the track as Mire ran in and he bowled it short outside off. Rode the bounce and guided it to third man
back of a length outside off, dabbed down to third man
length ball outside off, positive stride forward to play a checked drive to sweeper cover
flat, angling in towards the pads, clipped towards short midwicket
sees Misbah backing away to make room, tries to follow him. In the end, Misbah simply moves out of the way and lets it slide down the leg side
again he follows him as Misbah makes room, can only punch it back to the bowler this time
full on leg stump, nurdled away into the on side
tossed up on middle and leg, looks for the drive to long-on, and Raza is quick to dive across from straight midwicket to stop it
length ball on the pads, worked away through forward square leg
slanted down the leg side and Misbah sweeps in the air, down towards deep backward square leg
low full-toss on the pads, flicked towards deep midwicket
back of a length on middle and leg, punched back to the bowler
full and wide, driven away through extra cover, they pick up two easily with long-off having to cover a lot of distance to his left
length ball on off and middle. Presses forward and defends into the on side
sliightly short and he goes deep in his crease to pull to the right of deep midwicket
slanted across towards off stump, can't beat short third man with the reverse-sweep
once again Misbah exposes his stumps, once again Williams follows him. Punched away to sweeper cover
full on leg stump, punched to straight midwicket
fired in towards the pads, tucked away to the right of midwicket
some flight outside off and Misbah sweeps in the air down to deep backward square leg to bring up his fifty
length ball outside off, presses forward and dabs towards short third man
flat, on a nice length outside off. Comes forward and semi-defends, semi-dabs it to short third man. Off the outside half of his bat
back of a length on middle stump, goes on the back foot and works it away through square leg
tossed up on leg stump, clipped to the right of short midwicket, who moves quickly and slides to stop the ball
tossed up on leg stump, comes forward to defend and it turns in to hit him on the pad
back of a length, quickish, tucking Akmal up for room as he goes on the back foot. Works it to square leg
tossed up on off stump and he comes forward to drive to long-off
made room even before Raza delivered and he punched it away into the gap between point and cover, slows down three-fourths of its way to the boundary
short ball outside leg stump, slapped to short cover. That's how much room Misbah gave himself
short and wide, had to reach out to cut so he couldn't really get the power to force it through the gap to the right of point

whoa, bowled him! That was a flat, quick ball that straightened past the outside edge to hit top of off. Akmal made it look an even better delivery than it actually was, because he had moved inside the line and was trying to push that inside-out through cover
fired in down the leg side. Hits Afridi on the pads, was too quick for him to flick

whataball, whatabowler! Sean Williams does it again! Angled it in flat towards middle and off, and it turned away, past Afridi's defensive bat, and crashed into the top of off stump. Wow. What a birthday gift that was for Lala.
back of a length on off stump, punched to short cover
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away through backward square leg
down the track, and Maqsood is on his way with a lovely inside-out drive, into the gap between short cover and mid-off
back of a length on leg and middle, rocks back to pull that away towards long leg
flat and quick outside leg stump, whipped away towards deep square leg
back of a length on middle stump and he goes deep in his crease to tuck it away through square leg
back of a length on off stump, punched to long-off
fullish on middle stump, driven inside-out to long-off
back of a length, angling down leg, tucked away to backward square leg
moves across one way and another and comes back to an orthodox position by the time the bowler releases. Back of a length on middle stump and he punches it to short midwicket
fuller now, on off stump, driven down to long-off
length ball on off stump, pushed off the front foot to short extra cover
full on middle stump, driven inside-out to long-off
length ball on off stump, punched to mid-off
length ball on off stump, punched fluently but straight to point
back of a length outside off, shuffles across to whip it to short midwicket
short ball, pulled away to deep square leg
bouncer, and Misbah dips his head just enough - he's a minimalist like that - to allow the ball to go over it
back of a length, angling into leg stump, tucked away to the right of short midwicket
shortish on off stump. Clears his front leg and punches powerfully but can't beat short extra cover
full and flat on leg and middle, whipped to straight midwicket
a bit more air and he comes forward to work it through midwicket. Extra bounce and it pops off his pad into the leg side

down the track, and that has to go down as a drop. Got inside the line and drove with immense power, flat-batted it, inside out, and it must have stung Ervine's hands quite badly as he cupped them over his head to catch it
down the track and inside the line again, and this time he scoops under the ball to get the elevation and launch that over the cover fielder, bounces down and rolls into the boundary
a touch short, and just enough width for Sohaib to rock back and punch it past the left hand of the diving cover fielder
length ball on off stump, can't place that front-foot push past short extra cover
short and wide and that's a terrible start to his spell. Maqsood slashes it up and over backward point
got him! Back of a length, angling into the body, and Maqsood looked to whip it away through midwicket. It straightened off the pitch, and popped off the leading edge back to the bowler
full, angling down the leg side, clipped away to long leg
back of a length outside off, another slower legcutter. Misbah walks across and whips it away through midwicket
full, angling into a fourth-stump line. Wahab presses forward to block into the covers
length ball on middle and off, nurdled away to the left of straight midwicket
on the pads, clipped away through backward square leg
full outside off, Wahab is at full stretch to defend to short extra cover
fullish, angling into off and middle, and he gets his front foot across to clip it through midwicket
shuffles across a long way to tuck this from way outside off towards square leg
full outside off, presses forward to poke it into the covers
slower ball on off stump, Wahab defends back to the bowler
slower bouncer outside off, Misbah reaches out to play a controlled pull to midwicket
shortish outside off, mistimed swat down to mid-on
looks to angle it into the body, ends up slanting down the leg side
length ball outside off, stabbed away towards third man
back of a length outside off, shuffles across to dab it into the on side
and again. Short, angling in, angling too far down the leg side
short outside off, and he opens his face to steer it to third man, gets a thick outside edge and it goes much finer than anticipated, and runs away for four
full outside off, presses forward to defend into the off side
back of a length angling down leg, tucked off the pads towards square leg
back of a length, angling into the body, worked off the hips to long leg
length ball outside off, and Misbah *wait for it* shuffles across to work it into the leg side
slower ball outside off, comes forward to dab it towards cover point
short, sits up at chest height, Misbah pulls it away towards long leg
full on off stump, looks to clip to mid-on but short midwicket is quick to get in the way
length ball on off stump, poked away into the covers
length ball outside off, looks to open his bat face and steer to third man, but can't beat backward point
full and wide and he leans into it and eases it into the gap between point and cover
back of a length outside off, chopped down towards backward point
down the leg side, can't connect with the flick
back of a length outside off, angling in, and he opens his bat face to guide it down to third man
shortish ball on off stump, dabbed down to backward point
length ball outside off, presses forward and steers it to short third man
length ball on off stump, poked into the covers
full on off stump, pushed to cover point
quick and full on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
length ball, goes with the angle towards middle stump, defended into the on side
and he's bowled a maiden. In the 45th over. Flat length ball on off and middle, and it straightens just a touch and Wahab can only block it back to the bowler
sees Misbah taking a big step back and across, bowls it wider, ends up going past the tramline
full on off stump, clipped away through midwicket
length ball on off stump, gets his front pad out of the way and pokes it to cover point
fullish, angling into the pads as Wahab looks to make room. Goes for a swipe over the leg side, doesn't connect
shot! Down the track, he speared in a low full-toss at his feet, and he simply whipped his wrists to send it flying through square leg
slower ball outside off, waits on it and cuts it away into the deep backward point region
excellent shot. That was shortish, angling into the body, and swivelled and used his wrists to semi-pull, semi-whip that over the fielder at short fine leg
sees him make a bit of room and follows him with a back-of-a-length ball, whips it into the on side and Raza is quick as a flash to sprint forward from short midwicket to stop the single
short on off stump, backs away from leg stump and pulls to deep midwicket
shortish and a bit of width, and Misbah simply can't find his placement, stabs that straight to backward point
backs away from leg stump, and he whips the low full-toss, speared in at his feet, down to long-on

short, and that is some crisp hitting from Wahab. Had made a bit of room to hit through the off side, and used it well to free his arms and pull powerfully wide of long-on, one bounce and over the rope

and that is that. No century for Misbah, won't get anywhere near it. Sees him backing away and bowls it full at his feet. Went for the whippy pick-up shot and ended up spooning it straight into long-on's hands
full on off stump, pushed down to long-off
low full-toss, strikes him flush on the pad as he misses the flick. Big appeal, not given, was sliding down the leg side
back of a length wide of off, and Sohail can't steer that past backward point
full outside off, poked down the ground into the vacant mid-on region. Mid-off runs around to field it
backs away to make room, and in the effort to follow him with the yorker, he slips it marginally too far down the leg side
slower ball, angling in to tuck up the batsman, who whips it away through backward square leg
yorker on middle stump, and all Wahab can do is jam his bat down and prevent it from bowling him
backs away a long way, and he bowls it right up again, has a swing at it and misses and it goes through to the keeper, between batsman and leg stump
makes room again, manages to whip this full ball up and over midwicket. Doesn't hit it particularly well, and the fielder at deep midwicket can run around to stop it
slower ball outside off, dabbed away with soft hands towards point

whatashot! When you get your yorker slightly wrong, you can land it right in the slot. It's on off stump, and he clears his front leg to make some room and absolutely wallops it over the bowler's head

what happened there? Pokes it towards backward point and neither batsman made up his mind about whether or not to take the single. Both were stuck halfway down the pitch. Fielder had a long time to aim, took a long time, threw at the batsman's end, missed, and conceded an overthrow
back of a length, angling into middle and leg, tucked away to short fine leg
slower ball, angling towards the batsman's retreating feet. Looks to swipe at it and can't connect
another attempted slower ball, shorter, and ends up slanting it down the leg side. Wahab stood still this time, and maybe the bowler assumed he would move away from his stumps again

full-toss, and it's dropped by Matsikenyeri at deep square leg. He whipped it powerfully off his hips, and it was a simple catch at thigh height, and he put it down diving forward, despite getting both hands to it
full-toss angling down leg, can't connect with the flick, runs off the pad towards short fine leg

slower ball outside off, on a length, swiped down to long-on. Didn't time it at all, and that allowed them to think of the second. Sohail would have been run out had Chatara collected the throw properly. As it happened, he fumbled and knocked the bails off with his hands with the batsman still short
slower ball pitched up wide outside off, goes for the drive, misses, polite appeal from the keeper

short ball outside off, and Solomon Mire puts down the simplest catch offered to any fielder in the history of the game. Wahab swivelled to hook, and Mire at deep square leg settled under it, fingers pointing up, and it hit his palm and dropped straight out
fuller now, angling in, swiped away towards wide long-on
wide yorker. Wahab reaches out to slap it through point, can't connect
full and wide and that is a poor ball considering there was no one deep on the off side except long-off. Wahab cleared his front leg and swung cleanly through the line to launch it over extra cover

full-toss on off stump, swung away into the gap between long-on and deep midwicket, and that's Wahab's fifty. Super innings from him. 50 from 45 balls, despite having played out a maiden from Williams.

yorker on off stump, and that is a brilliant finish to the innings. Brilliant bat-speed to drill that down the ground, hit that so hard that long-off, who didnt have to move too far to his right, was sprawled full-length on the floor but still couldn't prevent the boundary

inn2.comm: excellent ball to start, angled across Chibhabha, and he has a bit of a nibble at it and fails to take a bite out of the ball
shorter now, angling away. Left alone and it pops into those pink gloves of Akmal at shoulder height
even shorter now and Chibhabha sways his upper body out of the way
short again, climbs over the right shoulder. Chibhabha tries to hook, makes no contact
back of a length, rises up to the ribcage. Hops off the ground to keep it down into the on side
shortish over off stump. Rides the bounce well and chops it down to third man
fullish outswinger wide outside off, left alone
length ball outside off, closer to the batsman but not close enough to invite the drive
fullish outswinger going away from off stump, presses forward to defend, inside-edges it into his pad

low full-toss outside off, punched down the ground, bounces over Sohail and races away to the boundary. Wahab chases from mid-on and puts in what seems an unneccessary dive, considering how hard this outfield is, and how possible it is to get injured on it
back of a length outside off, punched to backward point
fullish on off stump. Chibhabha punches it with a lovely vertical bat to mid-on
beauty. Back of a length, angling away outside off, goes for the angled-bat punch with feet in the air, is a long way from connecting
full now, a tiny bit of shape into middle stump to cramp Raza, who's stuck on the back foot and inside the line. Defended towards short cover
takes a big step back and across even before Irfan delivers, jumps in the air to defend his stock back-of-a-length ball into the covers
nasty ball, that. Short, and Raza jumped in the air and tried to sway out of the way, looking away from the ball. It follows him in off the pitch and hits him on the chest
follows that with the yorker, and Raza hurriedly moves his feet out of the way and overbalances while trying to jab it away into the leg side, hits it straight into his pads
and then another bouncer. This is a searing over from Irfan, and Raza ducks in a hurry, gets down into a low crouch
wow. Chibhabha skips down the track and Sohail bowls it full and wide. Frees his arms and hits it sweetly over mid-off
angles into the pads. Goes back and across to tuck it into the leg side, can't make contact, hits his pad and runs away towards fine leg
full outswinger close to off stump and Raza was only looking to defend that into the off side. Timed it perfectly and it raced away past the diving point fielder
full outside off. Raza shapes to leave, and the ball swings away and hits the face of his bat and rolls towards backward point
full on middle and off, stays inside the line to drive to short cover

full on middle and leg, and again that is excellent timing from Raza. Was only looking to push that down the ground, and his bottom hand came off the handle, but it sped away in a hurry to the left of mid-on
starts the over with another bouncer. Chibhabha bends at the waist and gets down low to evade it
back of a length outside off, stabbed to backward point
and there's the extra bounce. Back of a length, angling away. Pokes at it with an angled bat and it beats his edge, even though the slip fielders went up for a caught behind
gone! Poor technique from Chibhabha, swayed away to leave the short ball but left the bat pointing up, and ended up popping a simple catch to second slip
low full-toss on off stump, checked drive to the left of mid-off
another bouncer, over leg stump, Raza limboes out of the way
back of a length outside off, defended to short cover
full on middle and off, clipped away to the right of mid-on
in the blockhole on middle stump, clipped to mid-on
length ball outside off, presses forward to block into the covers
what a shot. That's a length ball on middle stump and he punches it sweetly down the ground, hits it too straight for his own good, smacks into middle stump at the other end
length ball on off stump, punched on the up to mid-off
short ball, looks for the hook from over the right shoulder, can't connect. This time the umpires think it's over head height, and they're right
back of a length on middle stump. Makes some room and pokes it away to backward point
full on leg stump, and it's clipped away past Rahat, who makes an ungainly and ineffective dive to his left from mid-on
short outside off and he slices under the ball and uppercuts to the right of third man

and another simple catch to second slip. Short, close to the body. Raza looked to make room and poke it away into the off side but it got big on him, hit the shoulder of his bat, and popped to Haris at a comfortable chest height
shortish, rising up above off stump. Taylor gets behind the line and defends towards short midwicket. May have hit his gloves
back of a length on middle and leg. Shuffles across to play it down towards backward square leg
full on middle and off, punched to mid-on
back of a length on off stump, a bit of shape away, defended back to the bowler
length ball on a fourth-stump line. Masakadza comes forward to block it back towards the bowler
full on middle stump, driven to mid-on
on the pads now, whipped away to long leg
length ball outside off, left alone
back of a length on off stump. Masakadza gets behind it, lets it come on, and dabs it softly towards short cover to pick up a quick single
fuller now, angling across towards off stump. Taylor gets a nice stride out to defend into the off side
back of a length now, Taylor rides the bounce and defends into the covers
a bit straighter now, and Taylor moves across to tuck it off his hips into the leg side
shortish outside off, left alone
shortish on off stump. Rises with the bounce and plays with soft hands towards point
full outside off, confident stride forward, punches to mid-off
length ball outside off, punched to short cover
full in the corridor, comes forward and defends to point

full on off stump and Masakadza whips his wrists at the end of his follow-through after the bat came down in a routine driving arc three-fourths of the way. Lifts it over the bowler's head and it races away to the straight boundary
back of a length on off stump, back and across to defend
back of a length on off stump, blocked to mid-on
gets some swing right away but it's a terrible short ball way down the leg side. Akmal has to throw himself to his left to prevent that from running away to the boundary
and again. Closer to leg stump this time but just as wide on the scorecard

bounce and zippy carry through to the keeper now. Again it's swinging a touch down the leg side and the batsman shaped to tuck it off his hip. Akmal went up for a caught behind appeal, it wasn't given, and Pakistan have a long discussion before deciding not to review. There seemed to be a spike on Hawkeye as it passed his glove there... Umpire didn't call it wide, so I suppose he thought it hit his shirt or his thigh pad
back of a length outside off, punched into the covers
back of a length on off stump, defended towards point
short ball on off stump and Masakadza loves them there. Clears his front leg to make swinging room and pulls it away with a lot of authority to the midwicket boundary
back of a length on leg stump, lets it come on and tucks it away into the on side
back of a length outside off, steered to third man
fullish ball on middle stump and he looks to drive, initially, and then checks his shot. Pops it in the air, and in the gap between bowler and mid-on
now it's Wahab's turn to bowl a wide down the leg side, doesn't get the finish of his action right
back of a length outside off, defended to mid-off

was there an edge on that? Umar Akmal didn't go up immediately after Taylor wafted at this back of a length ball angling across him but Wahab did. Again a discussion, again no review, and this time it's a good thing they didn't review. Nowhere near the edge
shortish on off stump and he jumps across to defend back to the bowler from a very open position
short and wide, and that is a lovely punch off the back foot, gets it into the gap between short cover and mid-off
again there's some width but this bounces quite steeply and beats the edge as Taylor leans back to slash
fullish outside off, a tiny bit of shape in, but Masakadza leaves confidently, trusting the bounce
a bit of shape in again and Masakadza's half-forward front pad was nearly in the way, in front of middle stump, but he moved it away just in time to play with a straight bat to short midwicket
length ball in the corridor, left alone
again, a nice length outside off, inviting the drive. Taylor ignores it

what a delivery. On a pitch with lower bounce that would have crashed into off stump. Drew Taylor forward to defend, and the angle opened up a tiny gap between bat and pad, and the ball swung in through that gap and climbed over off stump
length ball outside off, going with the angle this time. Taylor leaves it comfortably
ooh. Back of a length in the channel, good carry through to Akmal after Masakadza thinks about having a poke and pulls his bat away at the last moment
a bit wider now, Masakadza leaves it alone
oooh. Just that bit fuller and closer to off and Masakadza comes forward to defend and is beaten by angle and bounce
fuller, wider, leaves again, and it climbs through over head height to Akmal
back of a length on off stump, blocked towards mid-on, and the fielder, Sohail Khan, was a little slow to the ball and the batsmen easily ran one.
back of a length outside off, gets back and across to defend back to the bowler
back of a length on middle and off, shuffles across to work it into the on side but Rahat quickly moves to the ball from his follow-through and prevents the single
there's the poke again, and with the bowler's angle and extra bounce from the pitch, there was no way he was connecting with that sort of angled bat. Lucky not to edge it
similar sort of delivery, this time Masakadza leaves it alone
back of a length on off and middle, blocked back to the bowler
fuller now, and Masakadza is only half-forward to try and flat-bat that through cover, almost chops it onto his stumps. Lucky his back leg was in the way
full on off stump, defended to mid-on
another beauty. Fairly full in the corridor and Masakadza thinks about poking at it before withdrawing his bat from the line of the ball
back of a length, a little wider, Masakadza leaves it alone, playing a shot at an imaginary ball closer to off stump
this one is closer to off stump, and he defends into the covers
short and wide and Masakadza hammers it away to the backward point boundary, hitting it up and over the fielder in the circle
fuller now, angling away. Masakadza leaves it alone
a touch too straight and Masakadza shuffles across and whips it away towards deep midwicket
back of a length on off stump, back and across to defend with soft hands into the off side
length ball in the corridor, left alone
short outside off, slapped away to sweeper cover
back of a length, a hint of shape in towards off stump, defended towards point
banged in short, angling away from Masakadza. Well over head height, given wide. Replays show he also overstepped, by a long way. Lucky the umpire didn't notice that.
fullish now, wide outside off. Masakadza leaves it alone
length ball on off stump, blocked into the covers
back of a length, angling down the leg side. Taylor skips out of the way
back of a length outside off, defended into the covers
shortish on off stump, rides the bounce and defends back towards the bowler
fullish outside off and he goes hard at it with a lot of bottom hand and lifts it over the bowler's head. Slows down on its way to the long-on boundary
full and wide and Masakadza looks to hammer that over long-off and out of Brisbane. Luckily for the well-being of the ball, his bat was nowhere near making contact
bouncer, rising over Masakadza's left shoulder, too quick to hook
length ball angling away from off stump. Pushes at it with hard hands and inside-edges it into the leg side
too full, on off stump, and that is punched down the ground, such a good-looking shot, between the non-striker and mid-off. Holds the pose, left elbow a perfect inverted V
length ball, a bit of shape in towards middle stump, poked back towards the bowler
back of a length on leg stump, whipped away off the hips towards long leg
on the pads, clipped away to long leg
full, angling away outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, punched firmly to mid-off

adroitly done, Mr. Taylor. That was short, rising over head height, and Taylor seemed to be leaving it initially, but he ramped it at the last moment, bat vertical, above his head, and lifted it over the keeper's head. The ball had gone past him when he made contact
back of a length on off stump, punched into the covers
back of a length on off stump, punched to mid-off
what a shot. That was full but not really driving length, but there was enough width to free the arms and hit on the up through extra cover
back of a length outside off, left alone
tossed up outside off, looks for the drive to long off but Afridi dives to get in the way
that turned quite a long way, but was short enough for Taylor to get behind and push towards point
length ball, angling in towards middle and leg, defended towards mid-on
short and wide, cut away to sweeper cover
length ball on off stump, hangs back in his crease to punch to short extra cover
a bit of flight outside off, driven on the up to sweeper cover
length ball outside off, gets a good stride out to defend towards point

down the track, and Masakadza throws it away. Brilliantly caught by Misbah. Goes for a big shot and it's always angling away and he wasn't really to the pitch of it. Skies it a long way up, and Misbah backtracks from mid-off and falls onto his back as he catches it in front of his chest. Comes up with a broad grin, half delighted, half bemused.
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
fullish on middle and leg, clipped towards square leg
full outside off, driven to mid-off
short, rising ball in the channel. Taylor ignores it
full on off stump, driven down to long-on
tossed up outside off and he hits that brilliantly, stepping away from the line and hitting inside-out, over extra cover, well wide of the long-off fielder
there's the skidder, on a good length angling in towards off. Presses forward to defend, inside-edges into the leg side
a bit slower, more air outside off, defended to short cover
fulll on leg stump and that is a super shot .Just punched it, no follow-through, and shovelled it back over the bowler's head
pushed through quicker on off stump, defended into the on side, with the angle
short outside off, sits up at waist height and Williams swipes it away to the midwicket boundary. Rolled there at a glacial pace, and Sohail Khan chased it even slower
full on off stump, punched down the ground to mid-off
short ball angling into the body, goes for the hook, top-edges it towards fine leg
looks for the bouncer again and it ends up rising way over the batsman's ducking head and Akmal, jumping as far up as he could with his right arm at full stretch, came nowhere near catching it
full outside off and that is a confident drive from Williams, just moves into line and leans his weight into the shot to send it scuttling away to the square cover boundary
fullish on off stump, defended to mid-on
full on middle stump, defended with a nice straight bat to mid-on
tosses it up outside off and Taylor is turning it on here, another beautiful inside-out drive over extra cover, one bounce and over the rope
full, angling in towards off stump, driven back to the bowler
full on middle and off, clipped down to long-on
was that a drop? Short and angling away from Williams, who may have top-edged the cut, straight in and out of Akmal's gloves
fuller now, on off stump, driven down to long-on
full on the pads, tucked away through square leg
back of a length, a bit of shape in towards off and middle, tucked away towards short midwicket
length ball on off stump, pushed gently to Irfan at mid-on, and an easy single ensues
back of a length on off stump, defended down into the pitch, changes direction and rolls towards short third man
length ball outside off, defended towards short cover
shortish outside off, slapped away to sweeper cover
back of a length outside off, punched to short cover
fullish on middle stump, clipped to straight midwicket
ooh, looks to sweep from outside off, was too full for that. Misses it, and it turns in and bounces over the off stump and wide of the unsighted keeper towards fine leg
full on middle and leg, driven down to long on
shortish on middle and off, pulled away to deep midwicket
full on leg stump, clipped deliberately in the air, into the vacant area at deep midwicket
slides down leg and Taylor goes for the paddle, didn't seem to middle it but got enough on it to get it down very fine, not far from the keeper's feet
short ball and Williams is an excellent puller, rolls his wrists down and keeps it down towards long leg
slower ball, full on middle stump. Taylor read that and defended towards mid-on
back of a length, angling into off stump, defended towards mid-on and again they get a single after pushing the ball straight to a fielder
length ball outside off, steered away towards deep point
lucky, lucky Taylor. That was on a good length and it nipped back in off the pitch. Taylor was half-forward to defend, and he inside-edges it past his off stump
fullish outside off, poked into the gap between point and cover for another single
full, slanted wide outside off, left alone, and the umpire reckons it was wide enough to be a wide
length ball, closer to off, left alone again
similar delivery, a bit of shape in towards the keeper after Taylor leaves again
this is good bowling, angled across, closer to off stump, and there's a tiny bit of shape in now. Looks to defend into the on side and inside-edges into his pads
back of a length close to off stump. Stands tall and chops it down to third man
back of a length on off stump, prodded into the off side, to the left of Shehzad at backward point
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away towards square leg and Williams dives into the crease to complete his partner's 50th run
back of a length on off stump, blocked back towards the bowler
fullish outside off, defended to short cover
got him. That isn't the greatest delivery, back of a length down the leg side, and Taylor gets a tickle through to the keeper while trying to play the leg glance
back of a length outside off, dabbed towards short third man
back of a length, angling into middle stump and cramping Ervine for room, tucked away to short midwicket
fullish on the pads, clipped to square leg
back of a length close to off stump, punched to short cover
back of a length on off and middle, plays a cramped short-arm pull to deep midwicket. Rahat has overstepped again, and this time the umpire's spotted it
backs away from the stumps and Rahat bowls it very full on off stump. Crouches down low and slices it away to third man. They run the first run really hard and complete the second easily
back of a length on off stump, a bit of curl away, defended to short cover

length ball on off stump, punched back down the ground and Rahat fell away from the ball in his follow through but got his feet in the way of that shot, and somehow kicked it up in the air and into his hands
full on off stump, pushed down the ground to mid-off
length ball outside off, steered down to third man
back of a length outside off, dabbed away to third man
short ball angling into the body, pulled away to long leg
length ball outside off, poked away to the left of backward point
shortish outside off, Williams skips away from the line and looks to steer it to third man. Shehzad dives to his right at backward point to stop it
full now, a tiny bit of shape into off stump. Comes forward to defend, runs off the inside half of the bat towards square leg
short, a bit of width, and he stands tall and carves it away through cover point
and Akmal has dropped another This was a length ball, sliding across, and Ervine poked and got a thin edge that popped right out of Akmal's gloves
full on middle stump, tucked away to square leg
tossed up on middle and off, clipped through midwicket
down the track, hits it hard into the ground, bounces up to Afridi at chest height. For a moment the crowd thought he was caught and bowled
presses forward to this ball floated across, and steers it away to third man
short, wide, and that is crashed away towards the cover boundary. Sohail took an age to sprint to his left from deep point
back of a length outside off, defended towards mid-off

gone! What has Williams done? That was short, too close to the body to really control the cut, and he scooped it straight into Shehzad's hands at backward point. He caught that over his head, with two hands, and then gestured to his teammates to say he didn't pick it up until the last moment
length ball on a fifth-stump line, left alone
fullish on off stump, defended to mid-off
length ball outside off, presses forward to block to short cover
full on the pads, flicked away towards long leg
back of a length, hurries through towards off stump, defended off the back foot into the off side
that's the slider and Mire didn't pick it at all. Stood there and poked at it, playing for turn, and inside-edged it past his leg stump
oh, beauty. Floated up outside off and again it goes with the angle. Pushes at it uncertainly, playing for turn, and edges it through where a slip could have been
back of a length outside off, punched to short extra cover
short ball on leg stump, pulled to long leg
full, angling down leg, and it's clipped away to the right of short fine leg. Irfan makes stately pursuit, and the ball slows down enough to allow him to catch up
back of a length on middle stump, defended to short cover
back of a length on off stump, punched to short extra cover
fullish outside off, blocked to short cover
length ball on middle stump and Mire swipes across the line. Doesn't connect cleanly, and it drops down just beyond the reach of square leg running back towards the boundary
back of a length outside off, dabbed away to third man
full on off stump, poked away past the diving Shehzad at point
back of a length outside off, extra bounce to hit him on the glove as he tries to dab it towards third man
this time it's a little fuller and he manages to guide it away to third man
banged in and Mire seemed to pick that up a little late. Raised his hands to protect himself very late, and it sailed over his head. Again the umpire's missed a front-foot no ball
slower ball outside off, fairly full, thought about poking at it and left it alone in the end

he's struck again. That's Irfan's fourth. Perfect delivery, back of a length, close to off stump. Mire fishes uncertainly, not too far from his body, and it kisses the shoulder of his bat and Akmal takes a simple catch behind the wicket. He rolled his fingers over, and that moved away just a touch off the pitch
back of a length on off stump, defended towards point
in the blockhole on off stump, jabbed down the ground to mid-off

appeal for a slip catch here, and it isn't given. There seemed to be a case for lbw as well. Came in off the pitch and hit the back thigh and popped to slip. Good decision from the umpire on both counts. Would have definitely gone over the stumps
full and wide now, a bit of shape away and it beats Ervine's angled-bat slash
length ball angling into off stump, blocked back to the bowler
full outside off, driven to mid-off
length ball outside off, comes forward to steer it down to third man
beauty. Length ball in the corridor and Chigumbura pokes at it, ends up playing down the wrong line
back of a length on off stump, defended towards backward point
length ball, tight on off stump. Lets it come on and looks to dab it behind the wicket, can't get it past slip

oh man. How do you play this guy? He was getting behind the line of this shortish ball outside off, and Irfan had rolled his fingers over it again, and it came in sharply and smacked him in the stomach
back of a length outside off, and again Haris moves to his left from slip and stops that late dab from Ervine
full on leg stump, clipped to short midwicket
shortish, rising to ribcage height over off stump. Ervine jumps in the air to squeeze it away behind square leg
shortish outside off, flat-batted to mid-on
edged, and it sticks in Akmal's gloves again. It's shortish outside off and he goes for the slash and gets a thick nick that Akmal catches at shoulder height to his left
length ball outside off, left alone

and another! Caught Akmal bowled Wahab once again. It's fuller this time, on off stump, and it actually came in off the pitch as Mupariwa aimed a drive on the up, and took the outside edge, high up on the bat, and nestled in the keeper's gloves at chest height
back of a length, slides down the leg side
sweet! On off stump, nowhere near driving length, and he drives it on the up to the left of the short cover fielder
back of a length, leg-stumpish. Rises with the bounce and defends into the leg side
back of a length on off and middle, punched back to the bowler
shortish outside off and he gets on top of the bounce to chop it away, and it rolls away past Jamshed, who fails to bend down fully to pick that up to his left at backward point
full-toss on off stump, driven to long-off
turn this time, from a nice length on middle and off. Panyangara presses forward to defend, edges to short third man
full on middle stump, looks for the drive to long-off, Misbah throws himself to his right at short extra cover to field it
shortish on off stump, chopped down to backward point
short ball outside off, Chigumbura goes for the pull, doesn't connect
banged in even shorter outside off. He goes for a tennis-style smash and toe-ends it over slip, whrre Haris leaped in the air with both arms outstretched but couldn't reach it
back of a length, jags away from off stump, Chigumbura is squared up while defending, pops it off the outside edge towards point
back of a length outside off, poked away to the right of backward point
back of a length outside off, steered away to third man
back of a length in the corridor, makes some room to carve it away to third man
back of a length on off stump, chopped to backward point
fuller now, stays inside the line to steer it to sweeper cover
length ball on off stump, gets some turn away. Stays deep in the crease to poke it away towards backward point
tossed up outside off, driven inside-out to the right of Jamshed at sweeper cover, and he puts in an ungainly slide to stop it
full on middle stump, gets his front foot out of the way and drives to sweeper cover
that was the slider on a good length wide outside off, left alone
slower ball, ends up as a low full-toss on off stump, punched down to mid-off
fullish, angling into middle stump. Stays inside the line and bunts it towards cover
in the blockhole on off stump, jabbed away towards point
short, rising ball over off stump. Panyangara jumps, swaying his upper body out of the way
very full on off and middle, driven inside-out to sweeper cover

full, angling in and following Chigumbura who backs away to make room. He dabs it down into the pitch and they set off for the quick single. Sohail is quick to move to the ball in his follow through and underarm it into the stumps, but I think Panyangara was just in. Not out, says the big replay screen
a touch short, slapped away to sweeper cover
length ball angling into the pads, tucks it away to short fine leg and they run the quick single
length ball wide outside off, slapped straight to extra cover
length ball on middle and leg, a bit of turn, Chigumbura presses forward to defend
goes for the big hit now, down on one knee and hits across the line of a middle-stump ball, top-edges it but puts it in the gap wide of deep midwicket
quicker, flatter, slides on towards off stump, punched into the covers
length ball on off stump, smacked on the up to mid-off
length ball, angling into middle and leg, tucked away to short midwicket
back of a length on off stump, makes room and dabs it away to third man
full on off stump, almost a yorker, but this is what modern batsmen do to almost-yorkers. Stays deep in his crease, clears his front leg, and punches it hard down the ground, over the bowler's head
slanted down leg, can't connect with the flick, pops off the front pad towards short midwicket
short outside off, shuffles across to get closer to the line and scoops it away towards third man
lovely. Dipped on Panyangara as he stretched out to defend outside off and bounced past his outside edge
and again, this time he looks to drive and again it dips and turns past his angled bat
length ball angling in towards off stump, gets a big stride out and blocks it back to Afridi
back of a length now, outside off. Backs away and misses the carve through the off side

what a beauty this was. A bit slower and he was at full stretch to defend it outside off. Turned past his edge again and Akmal had his bails off in a flash. It's gone upstairs, but Panyangara indicates to his partner that he never moved his foot out of the crease, and he's right.
back of a length on off stump, dabbed to point, and Afridi's birthday, which began with a duck and took plenty of punishment in nine overs, ends with a superb maiden over
back of a length on the body, tucked away towards short midwicket
backs away to slap it through the off side and he bowls it shorter, extra bounce causes him to edge that towards third man
short, angling away from Chigumbura at 145kph, too quick to pull
slower ball now, back of a length, goes between the batsman and the stumps after he's into the pull too soon
shot! That's a length ball outside off and he makes a bit of room to smack that into the gap between cover and mid-off
short, angling away from Chigumbura, who stays leg-side of the ball and can't connect with the flat-bat slap
short outside off, bounces too high to connect with the pull
another bouncer and he shuffles across to try and fend it away into the leg side. Misses, and Akmal caught it over his head. That was definitely over Panyangara's head, should have been called wide
now he makes room to carve through the off side and Irfan bowls a slower bouncer outside off. Swings and misses again
full on off stump, stabbed down to mid-off
shortish outside off, pulled in the air, bounces down to deep midwicket
full on off stump, swiped down to long-on, keeps the strike with the single
backs away from leg stump and Wahab bowls a short one over leg stump. Swivels to pull, doesn't connect

fuller now, follows the backtracking batsman, and Jamshed puts down a dolly at deep midwicket. Swung hard, miscued it high, and the fielder was coming in from the boundary, he got right under it, it dropped into his cupped palms, and bounced right off

now the batsman goes the other way, shuffling across his crease. Wahab bowls it short on middle stump again, he swivels to pull, misses, and they try to steal a bye and Akmal rolls it at the stumps, misses, but the bowler picks it up and hurls it at the bowler's end, hits the stumps there, and catches Panyangara short of his crease
banged in short, Chigumbura goes for the hook, and top-edges it through to Akmal, who takes his fifth catch of the match, and Zimbabwe have been bowled out
